Posts.Content: Aug 18, 2009 05:09PM hugglez924 wrote: My BCBS insurance paid 100% as well.  And that was after I was informed that I may have to pay $375, which I didnt mind.  I felt that was a small price to pay to see if my mom (16 year breast cancer survivor who died from ovarian cancer last October) had passed on the mutated gene to me (yep, I tested positive). I had the expanders put in and then the implants (2 weeks ago).  All is going fine and I couldnt be more relieved.  And the insurance has been great (so far) about it all. I wish everyone had that luck.
Posts.Title: BRCA testing/costs/MYRIAD lab samiam40 SelenaRG
